Opcode.name: PCM_OP_SUBSCRIPTION_SET_PRODINFO
Opcode.Doc:
PCM_OP_SUBSCRIPTION_SET_PRODINFO input and output flist specifications. This opcode is called to modify or set a product's purchase, cycle, or usage date information. If the PCM_OPFLG_CALC_ONLY flag is set, this opcode returns the entire event flist for the events created as a result of the modification. If not, it returns the event POIDs of all event objects created as a result of the modification.
When automatic rerating is enabled, this opcode triggers automatic rerating of backdated product status changes when certain conditions are met.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: Account object action was applied to.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_SERVICE_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Service object action was applied to.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_SESSION_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Session object - session in which event took place - null means none.

String.name: PIN_FLD_DESCR
String.Doc: Event description - free text for application to describe event.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Start time - Timestamp of when event started (Portal Time).

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: End time - Timestamp of when event ended (Portal Time). This field is used to determine which billing cycle the event is part of.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_FLAGS
Int.Doc: This flags is used to truncate or extend the sub balance validity of non currency resources during Line Transfer. If the value is passed as PIN_RATE_FLG_CUT then the sub balance validity is truncated to date of transfer and iff the value is passed as PIN_RATE_FLG_MAINTAIN then the sub balance validity period is extended till the source account's current billing cycle end date and if the value is passed as PIN_RATE_FLG_ALIGN then the sub balance bucket is extended till the destination account's billing cycle end date.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_ACTG_NEXT_T
Timestamp.Doc: Accounting Next_T of the destination account used in extending the validity period of the sub balance bucket for the products during line transfer in case of business params for sub_bal_validity is configured to Align.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_PRODUCTS
Array.Doc: Products array. Only one element can appear in this array. Element-id is not relevant. It uniquely identifies the account product by its offering_obj.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_OFFERING_OBJ
Poid.Doc: Uniquely identifies a product in an account.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Purchase start time - timestamp that product activates (Portal Time).

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Purchase end time - timestamp that product expires (Portal Time), 0 means that product does not expire.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc: Relative Unit for Purchase Can be Seconds=1,Minutes=2,Hours=3,Days=4, Months=5, Cycles=8 and Event cycles=9. For First Usage unit should be passed as -1. For unit=0, the purchase end_t would be checked. If unit is 0 and purchase end_t is 0 then End Never. If unit is 0 and purchase end_t is greater than 0 then purchase end date is an Absolute date. Based on this the purchase end details would be calculated.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Purchase startT to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate Purchase endT on First Usage.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_DISCOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Purchase discount - percent discount applied to purchase/cancel rates of product. Mutually exclusive to PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_DISC_AMT field.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_DISC_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Fixed amount discount for purchase fees, amount of discount applied to purchase/cancel rates of product. Mutually exclusive to PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_DISCOUNT field.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_PURCHASE_FEE_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Purchase fee to be applied for this product. Amount specified here will override the price specified in the /rate object.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Cycle fee start time - timestamp that cycle fees begin for this product (Portal Time), 0 means immediately. This field should not be changed for an existing product.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Cycle fee end time - timestamp that cycle fees are no longer applied for this product (Portal Time), 0 means always applied.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc: Relative Unit for Cycle Can be Seconds=1, Minutes=2, Hours=3, Days=4, Months=5, Cycles=8 and Event cycles=9. For First Usage unit should be passed as -1. For unit=0, the cycle end_t would be checked. If unit is 0 and cycle end_t is 0 then End Never. If unit is 0 and cycle end_t is greater than 0 then cycle end date is an Absolute date. Based on this the cycle end details would be calculated.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Cycle to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate Cycle end_t.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_DISCOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Cycle fee discount - percent discount applied to cycle rates of product. Mutually exclusive to PIN_FLD_CYCLE_DISC_AMT field.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_DISC_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Fixed amount discount for cycle_forward fees amount of discount applied to cycle rates of product. Mutually exclusive to PIN_FLD_CYCLE_DISCOUNT field.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_CYCLE_FEE_AMT
Decimal.Doc: Cycle fee (both forward and arrears) to be applied for this product. Amount specified here will override the price specified in the /rate object.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_STATUS_FLAGS
Int.Doc:
Status flags used in conjunction with the override prices specified in PURCHASE_FEE_AMT and CYCLE_FEE_AMT. The possible values are: -
PIN_PROD_STATUS_FLAGS_OVERRIDE_PURCHASE_FEE(0x01000000)
PIN_PROD_STATUS_FLAGS_OVERRIDE_CYCLE_FEE(0x02000000)

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_START_T
Timestamp.Doc: Usage fee start time - timestamp that usage fees begin for this product (Portal Time), 0 means immediately.

Timestamp.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_T
Timestamp.Doc: Usage fee end time - timestapm that usage fees are no longer applied for this product (Portal Time), 0 means always applied.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_UNIT
Int.Doc: Relative Unit for Usage Can be Seconds=1, Minutes=2, Hours=3, Days=4, Months=5, Cycles=8 and Event cycles=9. For First Usage unit should be passed as -1. For unit=0, the usage end_t would be checked. If unit is 0 and usage end_t is 0 then End Never. If unit is 0 and usage end_t is greater than 0 then usage end date is an Absolute date. Based on this the usage end details would be calculated.

Int.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_END_OFFSET
Int.Doc: Relative offset for Usage to be used in conjunction with unit to calculate Usage end_t on First Usage.

Decimal.name: PIN_FLD_USAGE_DISCOUNT
Decimal.Doc: Usage fee discount - percent discount applied to usage rates of product.

String.name: PIN_FLD_DESCR
String.Doc: Description on a per product basis for CSR to add comments.

String.name: PIN_FLD_PRICE_LIST_NAME
String.Doc: Price list name associated with this offering.

Array.name: PIN_FLD_RESULTS
Array.Doc: Array of results information. Since only one event object is created by this call, only one element will be returned. The element-id is not significant.

Poid.name: PIN_FLD_POID
Poid.Doc: Poid of the event object created for event

Any.name: EVT_FLDS
Any.Doc: Fields of the event object. Additional event object fields are added to the return flist here. If the PCM_OPFLG_READ_RESULT flag is set for the operation, all the fields in the event object are returned on the output flist, not just the POID. If the PCM_OPFLG_CALC_ONLY flag is set, no fields in the database are changed and the event object is not actually created, but the fields that would have been used to create the event object are returned to the caller on the output flist.
